arcade.core.sim

Class Series

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.core.sim.Series
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PatchSeries, PottsSeries

    public abstract class Series
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract simulation manager for Simulation objects, differing only in random seed.

    The class is instantiated by parsing an XML document specifying model setup. Constructors for the Simulation objects are built, but not called to instantiate the simulation until the series is run. Series objects that are not valid are flagged with isSkipped and are not run.

    Simulation objects are passed their parent Series object.

              boolean isVis)
        Creates a Series object given setup information parsed from XML.
        Parameters:
        setupDicts - the map of attribute to value for single instance tags
        setupLists - the map of attribute to value for multiple instance tags
        path - the path for simulation output
        parameters - the default parameter values
        isVis - true if visualized, false otherwise

      • parseConversion

        protected static double parseConversion(java.lang.String convert,
                                        double ds,
                                        double dt)
        Updates conversion string into a value.

        Conversion string is in the form of D^N where D is either DS, DZ, or DT and N is an integer exponent. Conversions with DZ are replaced with DS. Multiple terms can be chained in the form D^N1.D^N2. The ^N is not required if N = 1.

        Parameters:
        convert - the conversion string
        ds - the spatial conversion factor
        dt - the temporal conversion factor
        Returns:
        the updated conversion factor

      • parseConversion

        protected static double parseConversion(java.lang.String convert,
                                        double ds,
                                        double dz,
                                        double dt)
        Updates conversion string into a value.

        Conversion string is in the form of D^N where D is either DS, DZ, or DT and N is an integer exponent. Multiple terms can be chained in the form D^N1.D^N2. The ^N is not required if N = 1.

        Parameters:
        convert - the conversion string
        ds - the spatial conversion factor in xy
        dz - the spatial conversion factor in z
        dt - the temporal conversion factor
        Returns:
        the updated conversion factor
